result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:35 AM Defendant Earl A Cross V appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Public defender is seeking counsel for defendant. Defendant states he completed a bond modification and put in the jail mailbox to come up last night.  Court has not yet received bond modification.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:10 PM Defendant Earl A Cross V appeared by video, in custody, without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Court reads charges.  Defendant has contacted public defender.  They have conflict and are going to be appointing private bar counsel.  Defendant makes motion to modify bond.  Court denies bond modification.  Defendant advised to file bond modification in writing.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:16 PM Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Karl Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.  No complaint filed yet.  DA Hayes speaks to the incident that occurred that resulted in the defendant's arrest. Court makes finding of probable cause. Bond set at $1,000 Cash with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.  Bond form.
Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
